page.title: 10Beckingham(Lincs)_The Parish
page.content: The village raises Â£225 per penny rate. It has a Parish Council of 5 people, a village hall run by a management group elected by the parish and a playing field run by a sub-committee of the Parish Council. There are five village charities. The Highways Trust which owns a 15 acre field, a Poor Garden Charity which owns a 2 acre field, and three other small charities administered by the Rector which raise money for education and the poor from invested monies. The village hall, founded in 1972, is a converted Methodist Chapel and is used regularly by the Parish Council, Swing into Shape and Mother & Toddler Groups. It is also used for meetings of the Cricket Club, the Management Teams of the Playing Field and the Village Hall and as a Polling Station at elections.
